  fhir:CodeSystem.purpose [ fhir:value "This value is published as part of FHIR in order to make the codes available to FHIR terminology services and so implementers can easily leverage the codes."];
  fhir:CodeSystem.copyright [ fhir:value "These codes are excerpted from Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine (DICOM) Standard, Part 16: Content Mapping Resource, Copyright Â© 2011 by the National Electrical Manufacturers Association."];

     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The AAPM TG18-LPV10 Pattern used to assess display resolution. This pattern has vertical bars consisting of alternating single-pixel-wide lines across the faceplate of display. The lines have a 12% positive contrast against 10% background level of the maximum pixel value. See [AAPM OR 03]" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 290;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "109859" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "TG18-LPV50 Pattern" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The AAPM TG18-LPV50 Pattern used to assess display resolution. This pattern has vertical bars consisting of alternating single-pixel-wide lines across the faceplate of display. The lines have a 12% positive contrast against 50% background level of the maximum pixel value. See [AAPM OR 03]" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 291;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "109860" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "TG18-LPV89 Pattern" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The AAPM TG18-LPV89 Pattern used to assess display resolution. The lines have a 12% positive contrast against 89% background level of the maximum pixel value. See [AAPM OR 03]" ]

     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "TG18-GVN Pattern" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The TG18-GVN Pattern used to assess display veiling. See [AAPM OR 03]" ]

     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "It is recommended that a new Procedure Step be scheduled to replace the Discontinued Procedure Step" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 454;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "110700" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Ventral Diencephalon" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Ventral structures of the diencephalon that cannot readily be distinguished on MR imaging, including the hypothalamus, mammillary body, subthalamic nuclei, substantia nigra, red nucleus, lateral geniculate nucleus, medial geniculate nucleus, zona incerta, cerebral peduncle, lenticular fasciculus, medial lemniscus, and optic tract. See http://neuromorphometrics.org:8080/Seg/html/segmentation/ventral%20diencephalon.html" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 455;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "110701" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "White Matter T1 Hypointensity" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Area(s) of reduced intensity on T1 weighted images relative to the surrounding white matter. These may be indicative of age-related or neurodegenerative white matter lesions, and may be co-located with areas of white matter T2 hyperintensity, but the concept is specifically confined to the MR appearance on T1 weighted images" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 456;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "110702" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "White Matter T2 Hyperintensity" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Area(s) of increased intensity on T2 weighted images relative to the surrounding white matter. These may be indicative of age-related or neurodegenerative white matter lesions, and may be co-located with areas of white matter T1 hypointensity, but the concept is specifically confined to the MR appearance on T2 weighted images" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 457;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "110703" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "superior longitudinal fasciculus I" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The dorsal component of the SLF originating from the medial and dorsal parietal cortex and ending in the dorsal and medial part of the frontal lobe. See Makris N, et al. \"Segmentation of Subcomponents within the Superior Longitudinal Fascicle in Humans: A Quantitative, In Vivo, DT-MRI Study.\" Cerebral Cortex 15, no. 6 (June 1, 2005): 854-69. doi:10.1093/cercor/bhh186" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 458;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "110704" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "superior longitudinal fasciculus II" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The major component of the SLF, derived from the caudal-inferior parietal region corresponding to the angular gyrus in the human and terminating within the dorsolateral frontal region. See Makris N, et al. \"Segmentation of Subcomponents within the Superior Longitudinal Fascicle in Humans: A Quantitative, In Vivo, DT-MRI Study.\" Cerebral Cortex 15, no. 6 (June 1, 2005): 854-69. doi:10.1093/cercor/bhh186" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 459;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "110705" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "superior longitudinal fasciculus III" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The ventral component of the SLF, originating from the supramarginal gyrus and terminating predominantly in the ventral premotor and prefrontal areas. See Makris N, et al. \"Segmentation of Subcomponents within the Superior Longitudinal Fascicle in Humans: A Quantitative, In Vivo, DT-MRI Study.\" Cerebral Cortex 15, no. 6 (June 1, 2005): 854-69. doi:10.1093/cercor/bhh186" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 460;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "110706" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Perilesional White Matter" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "White matter that surrounds a lesion of interest; e.g. to identify the otherwise unclassified white matter that surrounds a tumor to be surgically resected" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 461;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "110800" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Spin Tagging Perfusion MR Signal Intensity" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Signal intensity of a Spin tagging Perfusion MR image. Spin tagging is a technique for the measurement of blood perfusion, based on magnetically labeled arterial blood water as an endogenous tracer" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 462;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "110801" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Contrast Agent Angio MR Signal Intensity" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Signal intensity of a Contrast Agent Angio MR image" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 463;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "110802" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Time Of Flight Angio MR Signal Intensity" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Signal intensity of a Time-of-flight (TOF) MR image. Time-of-flight (TOF) is based on the phenomenon of flow-related enhancement of spins entering into an imaging slice. As a result of being unsaturated, these spins give more signal that surrounding stationary spins" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 464;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "110803" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Proton Density Weighted MR Signal Intensity" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Signal intensity of a Proton Density Weighted MR image. All MR images have intensity proportional to proton density. Images with very little T1 or T2 weighting are called 'PD-weighted'" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 465;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "110804" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "T1 Weighted MR Signal Intensity" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Signal intensity of T1 Weighted MR image. A T1 Weighted MR image is created typically by using short TE and TR times" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 466;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "110805" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "T2 Weighted MR Signal Intensity" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Signal intensity of a T2 Weighted MR image. T2 Weighted image contrast state is approached by imaging with a TR long compared to tissue T1 (to reduce T1 contribution to image contrast) and a TE between the longest and shortest tissue T2s of interest" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 467;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "110806" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "T2* Weighted MR Signal Intensity" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Signal intensity of a T2* Weighted MR image. The T2* phenomenon results from molecular interactions (spin spin relaxation) and local magnetic field non-uniformities, which cause the protons to precess at slightly different frequencies" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 468;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "110807" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Field Map MR Signal Intensity" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Signal intensity of a Field Map MR image. A Field Map MR image provides a direct measure of the B 0 inhomogeneity at each point in the image" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 469;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "110808" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Fractional Anisotropy" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Coefficient reflecting the fractional anisotropy of the tissues, derived from a diffusion weighted MR image. Fractional anisotropy is proportional to the square root of the variance of the Eigen values divided by the square root of the sum of the squares of the Eigen values" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 470;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "110809" ];

     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Signal intensity of a T1 Weighted Dynamic Contrast Enhanced MR image. A T1 Weighted Dynamic Contrast Enhanced MR image reflects the dynamics of diffusion of the exogenous contrast media from the blood pool into the extra vascular extracellular space (EES) of the brain at a rate determined by the blood flow to the tissue, the permeability of the Brain Blood Barrier (BBB), and the surface area of the perfusing vessels" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 478;

  ], [

     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Coefficient that describes the fraction of a beam of X-Rays or gamma rays that is absorbed or scattered per unit thickness of the absorber. This value basically accounts for the number of atoms in a cubic cm volume of material and the probability of a photon being scattered or absorbed from the nucleus or an electron of one of these atoms" ];

  ], [

     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "110876" ];

     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A radiographic projection that has been with the patient lying on a table with the X-Ray source on one side of the table and the detector on the other; e.g. may describe a cross-table cervical spine, chest or pelvis X-Ray image" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 617;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111071" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "CAD Operating Point" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "One of a number of discrete points on the Receiver-Operator Characteristics (ROC) curve that reflects the expected sensitivity and specificity of a CAD algorithm, where zero indicates the highest specificity, lowest sensitivity operating point. The value should not exceed the Maximum CAD Operating Point" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 618;

     fhir:index 712;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111207" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Image artifact(s)" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Signals that do not faithfully reproduce actual anatomic structures because of distortion or of addition or deletion of information" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 713;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111208" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Grid artifact(s)" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Feature(s) arising from the acquisition unit's anti-scatter grid mechanism. For two-dimensional systems, such features include those of mechanically damaged or incorrectly positioned grids. For moving or Bucky grids, artifacts may result from intentional grid motion that is inadequate in duration or velocity uniformity" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 714;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111209" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Positioning" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Inadequate arrangement of the anatomy of interest with respect to the X-Ray field and image detector sensitive area. Examples: 1) positioning is \"cutoff\" when the projection of anatomy of interest falls outside the sensitive area of the detector; 2) \"cone cut\", in which the X-Ray field does not adequately cover the anatomy of interest; 3) detector's sensitive surface is too small to cover the projection of the anatomy of interest; 4) improper angular orientation or \"rotation\" of anatomy of interest with respect to the X-Ray source, or detector; 5) projection of other anatomy or clothing over the anatomy of interest in the image" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 715;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111210" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Motion blur" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Unacceptable image blur resulting from motion of the anatomy of interest during exposure or the inadequately compensated motion of X-Ray source with respect to the image detector during exposure" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 716;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111211" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Under exposed" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Inadequate number of quanta reached the detector during exposure. Reasons for under exposed images include low kVp, low mAs product, excess Source Image Distance. Under exposed images have inadequate signal and higher noise in the areas of interest" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 717;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111212" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Over exposed" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "An excess number of quanta reached the detector during exposure. Reasons for over exposed images include high kVp, high mAs product, short Source Image Distance. Over exposed images have high signal and lower noise in the areas of interest. Over exposed area may demonstrate lack of contrast from over saturation of the detector" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 718;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111213" ];

         fhir:Coding.code [ fhir:value "M-72170" ];
         fhir:Coding.display [ fhir:value "Ductal hyperplasia, Usual" ]
       ]
     ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111249" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Ductal hyperplasia" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Hyperplasia is also known as epithelial hyperplasia or proliferative breast disease. It's an overgrowth of the cells that line the ducts or the lobules. Based on how the cells look under a microscope, the hyperplasia is called either ductal hyperplasia (also called duct epithelial hyperplasia) or lobular hyperplasia. Based on the pattern of the cells, hyperplasia may be called usual or atypical. In usual hyperplasia, the pattern of cells is very close to normal. Atypical hyperplasia (or hyperplasia with atypia) is a term used when the cells are more distorted. FROM: http://www.cancer.org/healthy/findcancerearly/womenshealth/non-cancerousbreastconditions/non-cancerous-breast-conditions-hyperplasia" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.property [
       fhir:index 0;

       fhir:CodeSystem.value [ fhir:value "deprecated" ]

     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111317" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Invasive lobular carcinoma" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Invasive lobular carcinoma is a type of breast cancer that begins in the milk-producing glands (lobules) of the breast. Invasive cancer means the cancer cells have broken out of the lobule where they began and have the potential to spread to the lymph nodes and other areas of the body. Invasive lobular carcinoma typically doesn't form a lump, which is common in breast cancer. Instead, there is a change in the breast that feels like a thickening or fullness in one part of the breast and is different from the surrounding breast tissue. FROM: http://www.mayoclinic.org/diseases-conditions/invasive-lobular-carcinoma/basics/definition/con-20033968" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.property [
       fhir:index 0;

     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Invasive tumor with cribriform pattern similar to cribriform DCIS. Low grade, cribriform appearance (well defined spaces formed by arches of cells) similar to cribriform DCIS but with larger cells, more cytoplasm and more vesicular nuclei: Tumor cells are small, often have apical snouts, mild/moderate nuclear pleomorphism; Also stromal invasion by islands of cells, often angulated; May have predominantly solid appearance; Associated with cribriform DCIS; Often mixed with tubular carcinoma. FROM: http://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/breastmalignantcribriform.html" ];

The horizontal centerline of the image should pass directly through the center of the disc" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1075;

The lower edge of the field is tangent to a horizontal line passing through the upper edge of the optic disc. The image is taken temporal to the macula but includes more retinal nasal and superior to the macula than standard field 2" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1076;

     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111625" ];

     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Scheimpflug Camera" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A slit reflected light microscope, which has the ability to form an image of the back scattered light from the eye in a sagittal plane. Scheimpflug cameras are able to achieve a wide depth of focus by employing the \"Sheimpflug principle\" where the lens and image planes are not parallel with each other. Rotating Sheimplug cameras are able to generate three-dimensional images and calculate measurements of the anterior chamber of the eye" ]

     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111806" ];

     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Test pattern consisting of 76 test point locations within 30Â° of fixation a minimum of 3Â° from each meridian and placed 6Â° apart" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1192;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111807" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Visual Field Peripheral 60 Point Test Pattern" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Test pattern consisting of 60 test point locations between 30Â° and 60Â° of fixation a minimum of 6Â° from each meridian and placed 12Â° apart" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1193;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111808" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Visual Field Full Field 81 Point Test Pattern" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Test pattern consisting of 81 test point locations within 60Â° of fixation that spread out radially from fixation" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1194;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111809" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Visual Field Full Field 120 Point Test Pattern" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Test pattern consisting of 120 test point locations within 60Â° of fixation that spread out radially from fixation, concentrated in the nasal hemisphere" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1195;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111810" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Visual Field G Test Pattern" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Test pattern for Glaucoma and general visual field assessment with 59 test locations of which 16 test locations are in the macular area (up to 10Â° eccentricity) and where the density of test location is reduced with eccentricity. The test can be extended with the inclusion of 14 test locations between 30Â° and 60Â° eccentricity, 6 of which are located at the nasal step" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1196;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111811" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Visual Field M Test Pattern" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Test pattern for the macular area. Orthogonal test pattern with 0.7Â° spacing within the central 4Â° of eccentricity and reduced density of test locations between 4 and 10, 5Â° of eccentricity. 81 test locations over all. The test can be extended to include the test locations of the Visual Field G Test Pattern between 10, 5Â° and 60Â°" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1197;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111812" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Visual Field 07 Test Pattern" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Full field test pattern with 48 test locations from 0-30Â° and 82 test locations from 30-70Â°. Reduced test point density with increased eccentricity. Can be combined with screening and threshold strategies" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1198;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111813" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Visual Field LVC Test Pattern" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Low Vision Central. Orthogonal off-center test pattern with 6Â° spacing. 75 test locations within the central 30Â°. Corresponds with the 32/30-2 excluding the 2 locations at the blind spot, including a macular test location. The LVC is linked with a staircase threshold strategy starting at 0 dB intensity and applies stimulus area V" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1199;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111814" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Visual Field Central Test Pattern" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "General test corresponding to the 30-2 but excluding the 2 test locations in the blind spot area, hence with 74 instead of 76 test locations" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1200;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111815" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Visual Field SITA-Standard Test Strategy" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Swedish Interactive Thresholding Algorithm (SITA). Strategy gains testing efficiency through use of visual field and information theory models. In: Bengtsson B, Olsson J, Heijl A, Rootzen H. A new generation of algorithms for computerized threshold perimetry, SITA. Acta Ophthalmologica Scandinavica, 1997, 75: 368-375" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1201;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111816" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Visual Field SITA-SWAP Test Strategy" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Adaptation of SITA testing methods to Blue-Yellow testing" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1202;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111817" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Visual Field SITA-Fast Test Strategy" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Similar to SITA-Standard but with less strict criteria for closing test points. Intended for patients who must be tested in the shortest possible time. In: Bengtsson B, Hejl A. SITA Fast, a new rapid perimetric threshold test. Description of methods and evaluation in patients with manifest and suspect glaucoma. Acta Ophthalmologica Scandinavica, 1998, 76: 431-437" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1203;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111818" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Visual Field Full Threshold Test Strategy" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Threshold test algorithm that determines a patient's sensitivity at each test point in the threshold test pattern by adjusting intensity by 4 dB steps until the patient changes their response, and then adjusts the intensity in the opposite direction by 2 dB steps until the patient changes their response again. The last stimulus seen by the patient is recognized as the threshold for that point. The starting values are determined by first thresholding a \"primary\" point in each quadrant then using the results of each primary point to determine the starting values for neighboring points" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1204;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111819" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Visual Field FastPac Test Strategy" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Similar to the Full Threshold algorithm except that it steps by 3 dB and only crosses the threshold only once. In: Flanagan JG, Wild JM, Trope GE. Evaluation of FASTPAC, a new strategy for threshold estimation with the Humphrey Field Analyzer, in a glaucomatous population. Ophthalmology, 1993, 100: 949-954" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1205;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111820" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Visual Field Full From Prior Test Strategy" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Identical to Full Threshold except that starting values are determined by the results of a previous test performed using the same test pattern and the Full Threshold test strategy" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1206;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111821" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Visual Field Optima Test Strategy" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Similar to FastPac except that the steps are pseudo-dynamic (differ based on the intensity of the last presentation)" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1207;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111822" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Visual Field Two-Zone Test Strategy" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Suprathreshold testing strategy, in which each point is initially tested using stimulus that is 6 dB brighter than the expected hill of vision. If the patient does not respond, the stimulus is presented a second time at the same brightness. If the patient sees either presentation, the point is marked as \"seen\"; otherwise it is marked as \"not seen\"" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1208;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111823" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Visual Field Three-Zone Test Strategy" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "An extension of the two-zone strategy in which test points where the second stimulus is not seen are presented with a third stimulus at maximum brightness" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1209;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111824" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Visual Field Quantify-Defects Test Strategy" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "An extension of the two-zone strategy, in which test points where the second stimulus is not seen receive threshold testing to quantify the depth of any detected scotomas" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1210;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111825" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Visual Field TOP Test Strategy" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Tendency Oriented Perimetry. Fast thresholding algorithm. Test strategy makes use of the interaction between neighboring test locations to reduce the test time compared to normal full threshold strategy by 60-80%. In: Morales J, Weitzman ML, Gonzalez de la Rosa M. Comparison between Tendency-Oriented Perimetry (TOP) and octopus threshold perimetry. Ophthalmology, 2000, 107: 134-142" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1211;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111826" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Visual Field Dynamic Test Strategy" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Dynamic strategy is a fast thresholding strategy reducing test duration by adapting the dB step sizes according to the frequency-of-seeing curve of the threshold. Reduction of test time compared to normal full threshold strategy 30-50%" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1212;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111827" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Visual Field Normal Test Strategy" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Traditional full threshold staircase strategy. Initial intensities are presented, based on anchor point sensitivities in each quadrant and based on already known neighboring sensitivities. In a first run, thresholds are changed in 4dB steps until the first response reversal. Then the threshold is changed in 2 dB steps until the second response reversal. The threshold is calculated as the average between the last seen and last not-seen stimulus, supposed to correspond with the 50% point in the frequency-of-seeing curve" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1213;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111828" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Visual Field 1-LT Test Strategy" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "One level screening test: Each test location is tested with a single intensity. The result is shown as seen or not-seen. The intensity can either be a 0 dB stimulus or a predefined intensity" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1214;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111829" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Visual Field 2-LT Test Strategy" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Two level screening test: Each test location is initially tested 6 dB brighter than the age corrected normal value" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1215;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111830" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Visual Field LVS Test Strategy" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Low Vision Strategy is a full threshold normal strategy with the exception that it starts at 0 dB intensity and applies stimulus area V" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1216;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111831" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Visual Field GATE Test Strategy" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "German Adaptive Threshold Estimation is a fast strategy based on a modified 4-2 staircase algorithm, using prior visual fields to calculate the starting intensity. In: Chiefer U, Pascual JP, Edmunds B, Feudner E, Hoffmann EM, Johnson CA, Lagreze WA, Pfeiffer N, Sample PA, Staubach F, Weleber RG, Vonthein R, Krapp E, Paetzold J. Comparison of the new perimetric GATE strategy with conventional full-threshold and SITA standard strategies. Investigative Ophthalmology and Visual Science, 2009, 51: 488-494" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1217;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111832" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Visual Field GATEi Test Strategy" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Similar to GATE. The i stands for initial. If there was no prior visual field test to calculate the starting values, an anchor point method is used to define the local start values" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1218;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111833" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Visual Field 2LT-Dynamic Test Strategy" ];

  ], [
     fhir:index 1219;

  ], [
     fhir:index 1220;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111835" ];

     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Takes neighborhood test point results into account and offers stimuli with an adapted value to save time" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1221;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111836" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Visual Field CLIP Test Strategy" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Continuous Luminance Incremental Perimetry, which measures at first the individual reaction time of the patient and threshold values in every quadrant. The starting value for the main test is slightly below in individual threshold" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1222;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111837" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Visual Field CLASS Strategy" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A supra threshold screening strategy. The starting stimuli intensities depend on the classification of the patient's visual hill by measuring the central (fovea) or peripheral (15Â° meridian) threshold. The result of each dot slightly underestimates the sensitivity value (within 5 dB)" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1223;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111838" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Age corrected" ];

     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111843" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Automated Optical" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Real time evaluation of the camera image to recognize blinks and fixation losses with influence on the test procedure. Blinks that interfere with stimuli presentation cause the automated repetition of such stimulus presentations.   ], [

     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111938" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "p<1%" ];

  ], [
     fhir:index 1281;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111939" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "p<0.5%" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Assuming the null hypothesis is true, the conditional percent probability of observing this result is statistically significant, 99.5% unlikely to happen by chance" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1282;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111940" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Corneal axial power map" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A two dimensional representation of the axial curvature of the cornea. Axial curvature is calculated from the reciprocal of the distance from a point on a meridian normal at the point to the corneal topographer axis. Also known as sagittal curvature" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1283;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111941" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Corneal instantaneous power map" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A two dimensional representation of the instantaneous curvature of the cornea. Instantaneous curvature is calculated from the reciprocal of the distance from a point on a meridian normal at the point to the center of curvature of that point. Also called tangential curvature" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1284;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111942" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Corneal refractive power map" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A two dimensional representation of the refractive power of the cornea. Corneal refractive power is calculated using Snell's Law" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1285;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111943" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Corneal elevation map" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A two dimensional representation of the elevation of the cornea. Elevation is calculated as the distance from a point on the corneal surface to a point on a reference surface along a line parallel to the corneal topographer axis. For the purpose of visualization the reference surface is usually a sphere or an ellipse" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1286;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111944" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Corneal wavefront map" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A two dimensional representation of a wavefront aberration surface of the cornea. Wavefront aberration surface is calculated from the corneal elevation data fit with either the Zernike polynomial series or the Fourier Series. Maps generally display total aberrations and selectable higher order aberrations" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1287;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111945" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Elevation-based corneal tomographer" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A device that measures corneal anterior surface shape using elevation-based methods (stereographic and light slit-based). Rasterstereography images a grid pattern illuminating the fluorescein dyed tear film with 2 cameras to produce 3D. Slit-based devices scan the cornea, usually by rotation about the instrument axis centered on the cornea vertex" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1288;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111946" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Reflection-based corneal topographer" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A reflection-based device that projects a pattern of light onto the cornea and an image of the reflection of that pattern from the tear film is recorded in one video frame. Light patterns include the circular mire pattern (Placido disc) and spot matrix patterns. Sequential scanning of light spots reflected from the corneal surface is also used requiring multiple video frames for recording" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1289;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "111947" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Interferometry-based corneal tomographer" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "An Interference-based device that projects a beam of light onto and through the cornea. Light reflected from within the cornea is combined with a reference beam giving rise to an interference pattern. Appropriately scanned, this imaging is used to construct 3-dimensional images of the cornea from anterior to posterior surfaces; e.g. swept source OCT" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1290;

  ], [
     fhir:index 1321;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112031" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Attenuation Coefficient" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A quantitative numerical statement of the relative attenuation of the X-Ray beam at a specified point. Coefficient that describes the fraction of a beam of X-Rays or gamma rays that is absorbed or scattered per unit thickness of the absorber. This value basically accounts for the number of atoms in a cubic cm volume of material and the probability of a photon being scattered or absorbed from the nucleus or an electron of one of these atoms. Usually expressed in Hounsfield units [referred to as CT Number in Fraser and Pare]" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1322;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112032" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Threshold Attenuation Coefficient" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "An X-Ray attenuation coefficient that is used as a threshold; e.g. in calcium scoring" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1323;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112033" ];

  ], [
     fhir:index 1330;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112040" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Tracking Unique Identifier" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A unique identifier used for tracking a finding or feature, potentially across multiple reporting objects, over time" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1331;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112041" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Target Lesion Complete Response" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Disappearance of all target lesions" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1332;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112042" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Target Lesion Partial Response" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "At least a 30% decrease in the sum of the Longest Diameter of target lesions, taking as reference the baseline sum Longest Diameter" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1333;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112043" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Target Lesion Progressive Disease" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "At least a 20% increase in the sum of the Longest Diameter of target lesions, taking as reference the smallest sum Longest Diameter recorded since the treatment started, or the appearance of one or more new lesions" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1334;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112044" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Target Lesion Stable Disease" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for Partial Response nor sufficient increase to qualify for Progressive Disease, taking as reference the smallest sum Longest Diameter since the treatment started" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1335;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112045" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Non-Target Lesion Complete Response" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Disappearance of all non-target lesions and normalization of tumor marker level" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1336;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112046" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Non-Target Lesion Incomplete Response or Stable Disease" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Persistence of one or more non-target lesions and/or maintenance of tumor marker level above the normal limits" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1337;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112047" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Non-Target Lesion Progressive Disease" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Appearance of one or more new lesions and/or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1338;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112048" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Current Response" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The current response evaluation for treatment of solid tumors, according to a method such as RECIST" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1339;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112049" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Best Overall Response" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Best response recorded from the start of the treatment until disease progression/recurrence, taking as reference for Progressive Disease the smallest measurements recorded since the treatment started, according to a method such as RECIST" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1340;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112050" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Anatomic Identifier" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A text identifier of an anatomic feature when a multiplicity of features of that type may be present, such as \"Rib 1\", \"Rib 2\" or thoracic vertebrae \"T1\" or \"T2\"" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1341;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112051" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Measurement of Response" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A measured or calculated evaluation of response; e.g. according to a method such as RECIST, the value would be the calculated sum of the lengths of the longest axes of a set of target lesions" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1342;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112052" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Bronchovascular" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Of or relating to a bronchial (lung) specific channel for the conveyance of a body fluid" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1343;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112053" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Osseous" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Of, relating to, or composed of bone" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1344;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112054" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Secondary pulmonary lobule" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The smallest unit of lung surrounded by connective tissue septa; the unit of lung subtended by any bronchiole that gives off three to five terminal bronchioles [Fraser and Pare]" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1345;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112055" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Agatston scoring method" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A method of calculating an overall calcium score, reflecting the calcification of coronary arteries, based on the maximum X-Ray attenuation coefficient and the area of calcium deposits" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1346;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112056" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Volume scoring method" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A method of calculating an overall calcium score, reflecting the calcification of coronary arteries, based on the volume of each calcification, typically expressed in mm3" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1347;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112057" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Mass scoring method" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A method of calculating an overall calcium score, reflecting the calcification of coronary arteries, based on the total mass of calcification, typically expressed in mg" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1348;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112058" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Calcium score" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A measure often arrived at through calculation of findings from CT examination, which is a common predictor of significant stenosis of the coronary arteries" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1349;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112059" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Primary complex" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The combination of a focus of pneumonia due to a primary infection with granulomas in the draining hilar or mediastinal lymph nodes [Fraser and Pare]" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1350;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112060" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Oligemia" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "General or local decrease in the apparent width of visible pulmonary vessels, suggesting less than normal blood flow (reduced blood flow) [Fraser and Pare]" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1351;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112061" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Abnormal lines (1D)" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Linear opacity of very fine width, i.e., a nearly one dimensional opacity" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1352;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112062" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Abnormal lucency" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Area of abnormal very low X-Ray attenuation, typically lower than aerated lung when occurring in or projecting over lung, or lower than soft tissue when occurring in or projecting over soft tissue" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1353;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112063" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Abnormal calcifications" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A calcific opacity within the lung that may be organized, but does not display the trabecular organization of true bone [Fraser and Pare]" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1354;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112064" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Abnormal texture" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Relatively homogeneous, extended, pattern of abnormal opacity in the lung, typically low in contrast" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1355;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112065" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Reticulonodular pattern" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A collection of innumerable small, linear, and nodular opacities that together produce a composite appearance resembling a net with small superimposed nodules. The reticular and nodular elements are dimensionally of similar magnitude [Fraser and Pare]" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1356;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112066" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Beaded septum sign" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Irregular septal thickening that suggests the appearance of a row of beads; usually a sign of lymphangitic carcinomatosis, but may also occur rarely in sarcoidosis [Fraser and Pare]" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1357;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112067" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Nodular pattern" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A collection of innumerable, small discrete opacities ranging in diameter from 2-10 mm, generally uniform in size and widespread in distribution, and without marginal spiculation [Fraser and Pare]" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1358;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112068" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Pseudoplaque" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "An irregular band of peripheral pulmonary opacity adjacent to visceral pleura that simulates the appearance of a pleural plaque and is formed by coalescence of small nodules [Fraser and Pare] " ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1359;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112069" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Signet-ring sign" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A ring of opacities (usually representing a dilated, thick-walled bronchus) in association with a smaller, round, soft tissue opacity (the adjacent pulmonary artery) suggesting a \"signet ring\" [Fraser and Pare]" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1360;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112070" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Air bronchiologram" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Equivalent of air bronchogram, but in airways assumed to be bronchioles because of peripheral location and diameter [Fraser and Pare]" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1361;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112071" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Air bronchogram" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Radiographic shadow of an air-containing bronchus; presumed to represent an air-containing segment of the bronchial tree (identity often inferred) [Fraser and Pare]" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1362;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112072" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Air crescent" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Air in a crescentic shape in a nodule or mass, in which the air separates the outer wall of the lesion from an inner sequestrum, which most commonly is a fungus ball of Aspergillusspecies [Fraser and Pare]" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1363;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112073" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Halo sign" ];

  ], [
     fhir:index 1364;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112074" ];

  ], [
     fhir:index 1365;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112075" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Non-Target Lesion at Baseline" ];

  ], [

     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112076" ];

  ], [
     fhir:index 1367;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112077" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Vasoconstriction" ];

  ], [
     fhir:index 1368;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112078" ];

  ], [
     fhir:index 1369;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112079" ];

  ], [
     fhir:index 1370;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112080" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Mosaic perfusion" ];

  ], [
     fhir:index 1371;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112081" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Pleonemia" ];

  ], [
     fhir:index 1372;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112082" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Interface" ];

  ], [
     fhir:index 1373;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112083" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Line" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A longitudinal opacity no greater than 2 mm in width [Fraser and Pare]" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1374;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112084" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Lucency" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The shadow of an absorber that attenuates the primary X-Ray beam less effectively than do surrounding absorbers. In a radiograph, any circumscribed area that appears more nearly black (of greater photometric density) than its surround [Fraser and Pare]" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1375;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112085" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Midlung window" ];

  ], [
     fhir:index 1376;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112086" ];

  ], [
     fhir:index 1377;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112087" ];

  ], [

  ], [

  ], [

     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112094" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Stripe" ];

  ], [
     fhir:index 1385;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112095" ];

  ], [

     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112096" ];

  ], [
     fhir:index 1392;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112102" ];

  ], [
     fhir:index 1393;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112103" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Arch of the Azygos vein" ];

  ], [
     fhir:index 1394;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112104" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Air-fluid level" ];

  ], [
     fhir:index 1395;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112105" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Corona radiata" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A circumferential pattern of fine linear spicules, approximately 5 mm long, extending outward from the margin of a solitary pulmonary nodule through a zone of relative lucency [Fraser and Pare]" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1396;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112106" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Honeycomb pattern" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A number of closely approximated ring shadows representing air spaces 5-10 mm in diameter with walls 2-3 mm thick that resemble a true honeycomb; implies \"end-stage\" lung [Fraser and Pare]" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1397;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112107" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Fleischner's line(s)" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A straight, curved, or irregular linear opacity that is visible in multiple projections; usually situated in the lower half of the lung; vary markedly in length and width [Fraser and Pare]" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1398;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112108" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Intralobular lines" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Fine linear opacities present in a lobule when the intralobular interstitium is thickened. When numerous, they may appear as a fine reticular pattern [Fraser and Pare]" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1399;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112109" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Kerley A line" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Essentially straight linear opacity 2-6 cm in length and 1-3 mm in width, usually in an upper lung zone [Fraser and Pare]" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1400;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112110" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Kerley B line" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A straight linear opacity 1.5-2 cm in length and 1-2 mm in width, usually at the lung base [Fraser and Pare]" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1401;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112111" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Kerley C lines" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A group of branching, linear opacities producing the appearing of a fine net, at the lung base [Fraser and Pare]" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1402;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112112" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Parenchymal band" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Elongated opacity, usually several millimeters wide and up to about 5 cm long, often extending to the pleura, which may be thickened and retracted at the site of contact [Fraser and Pare]" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1403;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112113" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Reticular pattern" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A collection of innumerable small linear opacities that together produce an appearance resembling a net [Fraser and Pare]" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1404;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112114" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Septal line(s)" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Usually used in the plural, a generic term for linear opacities of varied distribution produced when the interstitium between pulmonary lobules is thickened [Fraser and Pare]" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1405;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112115" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Subpleural line" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A thin curvilinear opacity, a few millimeters or less in thickness, usually less than 1 cm from the pleural surface and paralleling the pleura [Fraser and Pare]" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1406;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112116" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Tramline shadow" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Parallel or slightly convergent linear opacities that suggest the planar projection of tubular structures and that correspond in location and orientation to elements of the bronchial tree [Fraser and Pare]" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1407;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112117" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Tubular shadow" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Paired, parallel, or slightly convergent linear opacities presumed to represent the walls of a tubular structure seen en face; used if the anatomic nature of a shadow is obscure [Fraser and Pare]" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1408;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112118" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Density" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The opacity of a radiographic shadow to visible light; film blackening; the term should never be used to mean an \"opacity\" or \"radiopacity\" [Fraser and Pare]" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1409;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112119" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Dependent opacity" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Subpleural increased attenuation in dependent lung. The increased attenuation disappears when the region of lung is nondependent; a.k.a. dependent increased attenuation [Fraser and Pare]" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1410;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112120" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Ground glass opacity" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Hazy increased attenuation of lung, but with preservation of bronchial and vascular margins; caused by partial filling of air spaces, interstitial thickening, partial collapse of alveoli, normal expiration, or increased capillary blood volume [Fraser and Pare]" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1411;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112121" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Infiltrate" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Any ill-defined opacity in the lung [Fraser and Pare]" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1412;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112122" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Micronodule" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Discrete, small, round, focal opacity of at least soft tissue attenuation and with a diameter no greater than 7 mm [Fraser and Pare]" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1413;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112123" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Phantom tumor (pseudotumor)" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A shadow produced by a local collection of fluid in one of the interlobar fissures, usually elliptic in one radiographic projection and rounded in the other, resembling a tumor [Fraser and Pare]" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1414;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112124" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Shadow" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Any perceptible discontinuity in film blackening attributed to the attenuation of the X-Ray beam by a specific anatomic absorber or lesion on or within the body of the patient; to be employed only when more specific identification is not possible [Fraser and Pare]" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1415;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112125" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Small irregular opacities" ];

     fhir:index 1416;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112126" ];

  ], [
     fhir:index 1417;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112127" ];

  ], [
     fhir:index 1418;

  ], [
     fhir:index 1419;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112129" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Miliary pattern" ];

  ], [
     fhir:index 1420;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112130" ];

  ], [
     fhir:index 1421;

The profusion categories may be further subdivided by employing a 12-point scale [Fraser and Pare]" ]

  ], [
     fhir:index 1472;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112182" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Median Attenuation Coefficient" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The value in an ordered set of X-Ray attenuation coefficients, below and above which there is an equal number of values" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1473;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112183" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Standard Deviation of Attenuation Coefficient" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "For a set of X-Ray attenuation coefficients: 1) a measure of the dispersion of a frequency distribution that is the square root of the arithmetic mean of the squares of the deviation of each of the class frequencies from the arithmetic mean of the frequency distribution; 2) a parameter that indicates the way in which a probability function or a probability density function is centered around its mean and that is equal to the square root of the moment in which the deviation from the mean is squared" ]
  ], [

  ], [

     fhir:index 1502;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112240" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "C0 - Inadequate Study/Awaiting Prior Comparisons" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "An inadequate study or a study that is awaiting prior comparisons. The study may have inadequate preparation and cannot exclude lesions greater than or equal to ten millimeters owing to presence of fluid or feces. The study may have inadequate insufflation where one or more colonic segments collapsed on both views. Based on \"CT Colonography Reporting and Data System: A Consensus Proposal\", Radiology, July 2005; 236:3-9" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1503;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112241" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "C1 - Normal Colon or Benign Lesion" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The study has a normal colon or benign lesion, with the recommendation to continue routine screening. The study has no visible abnormalities of the colon. The study has no polyps greater than six millimeters. The study may have lipoma, inverted diverticulum, or nonneoplastic findings, such as colonic diverticula. Based on \"CT Colonography Reporting and Data System: A Consensus Proposal\", Radiology, July 2005; 236:3-9" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1504;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112242" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "C2 - Intermediate Polyp or Indeterminate Finding" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The study has an intermediate polyp or indeterminate finding and surveillance or colonoscopy is recommended. There may be intermediate polyps between six and nine millimeters and there are less than three in number. The study may have an intermediate finding and cannot exclude a polyp that is greater than or equal to six millimeters in a technically adequate exam. Based on \"CT Colonography Reporting and Data System: A Consensus Proposal\", Radiology, July 2005; 236:3-9" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1505;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "112243" ];

     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The study has a polyp, possibly advanced adenoma, and a follow-up colonoscopy is recommended. The study has a polyp greater than or equal to ten millimeters or the study has three or more polyps that are each between six to nine millimeters. Based on \"CT Colonography Reporting and Data System: A Consensus Proposal\", Radiology, July 2005; 236:3-9" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1506;

     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Values are derived by calculating values based on the time course of signal" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1654;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113067" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Temperature encoded" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Values are derived by calculating values based on temperature encoding" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1655;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113068" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Student's T-Test" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Values are derived by calculating the value of the Student's T-Test statistic from multiple image samples" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1656;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113069" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Time To Peak" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The time from the start of the contrast agent injection to the maximum enhancement value" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1657;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113070" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Velocity encoded" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Values are derived by calculating values based on velocity encoded; e.g. phase contrast" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1658;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113071" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Z-Score" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Values are derived by calculating the value of the Z-Score statistic from multiple image samples" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1659;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113072" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Multiplanar reformatting" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Values are derived by reformatting in a flat plane other than that originally acquired" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1660;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113073" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Curved multiplanar reformatting" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Values are derived by reformatting in a curve plane other than that originally acquired" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1661;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113074" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Volume rendering" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Values are derived by volume rendering of acquired data" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1662;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113075" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Surface rendering" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Values are derived by surface rendering of acquired data" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1663;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113076" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Segmentation" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Values are derived by segmentation (classification into tissue types) of acquired data" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1664;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113077" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Volume editing" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Values are derived by selectively editing acquired data (removing values from the volume), such as in order to remove obscuring structures or noise" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1665;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113078" ];

     fhir:index 1666;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113079" ];

  ], [
     fhir:index 1667;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113080" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Glutamate and glutamine" ];

  ], [

     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113091" ];

  ], [
     fhir:index 1684;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113100" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Basic Application Confidentiality Profile" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "De-identification using a profile defined in PS3.15 that requires removing all information related to the identity and demographic characteristics of the patient, any responsible parties or family members, any personnel involved in the procedure, the organizations involved in ordering or performing the procedure, additional information that could be used to match instances if given access to the originals, such as UIDs, dates and times, and private attributes, when that information is present in the non-Pixel Data Attributes, including graphics or overlays" ]
  ], [

     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113101" ];

  ], [
     fhir:index 1686;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113102" ];

  ], [

     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113748" ];

     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Table Longitudinal Position" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Table Longitudinal Position with respect to an arbitrary chosen reference by the equipment. Table motion towards LAO is positive assuming that the patient is positioned supine and its head is in normal position" ]
  ], [

  ], [

     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113754" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Table Head Tilt Angle" ];

     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113802" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "DLP to E conversion via measurement" ];

  ], [
     fhir:index 1850;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113803" ];

     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113804" ];

     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The CT acquisition was performed by acquiring single or multi detector data while rotating the source about the gantry while the table is not moving. Additional slices are acquired by incrementing the table position and again rotating the source about the gantry while the table is not moving" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1852;

  ], [
     fhir:index 1883;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113836" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "CTDIfreeair Calculation Factor" ];

  ], [
     fhir:index 1884;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113837" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Mean CTDIfreeair" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The average value of the free-in-air CTDI associated with this acquisition" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1885;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113838" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "DLP" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Dose Length Product (DLP), expressed in mGy-cm, is an index characterizing the product of the CTDIvol and the length scanned. For Spiral scanning, DLP = CTDIvol x Scanning Length. For Sequenced scanning, DLP = CTDIvol x Nominal Total Collimation Width x Cumulative Exposure Time / Exposure Time per Rotation. For Stationary and Free scanning, DLP = CTDIvol x Nominal Total Collimation Width" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1886;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113839" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Effective Dose" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Effective dose in mSv" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1887;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113840" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Effective Dose Conversion Factor" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Effective Dose per DLP, reference value for Effective Dose calculation, expressed in mSv/mGY.cm" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1888;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113841" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "ICRP Pub 103" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Effective Dose Reference authority 2007 Recommendations of the International Commission on Radiological Protection (ICRP Publication 103, published as the Annals of the ICRP Vol. 37, No. 2-4, Elsevier, 2007)" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1889;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113842" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "X-Ray Modulation Type" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The type of exposure modulation used for the purpose of limiting the dose" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1890;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113845" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Exposure Index" ];

  ], [
     fhir:index 1891;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113846" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Target Exposure Index" ];

  ], [
     fhir:index 1892;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113847" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Deviation Index" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A scaled representation of the accuracy of the Exposure Index compared to the Target Exposure Index as defined in IEC 62494-1; see PS3.3 definition of Exposure Index Macro" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1893;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113850" ];

  ], [
     fhir:index 1894;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113851" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Irradiation Administering" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The person responsible for the administration of radiation" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1895;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113852" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Irradiation Event" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "An irradiation event is the loading of X-Ray equipment caused by a single continuous actuation of the equipment's irradiation switch, from the start of the loading time of the first pulse until the loading time trailing edge of the final pulse. Any automatic on-off switching of the irradiation source during the event is not treated as separate events, rather the event includes the time between start and stop of irradiation as triggered by the user; e.g. a pulsed fluoro X-Ray acquisition shall be treated as a single irradiation event" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1896;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113853" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Irradiation Event UID" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Unique Identifier of an Irradiation Event" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1897;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113854" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Source of Dose Information" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Method by which dose-related details of an Irradiation Event were obtained" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1898;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113855" ];

  ], [

Value is distinct from (1113825, DCM, \"Scanning Length\"), which is the actual length of the table travel during the entire tube loading, according to IEC 60601-2-44, and includes overranging. Also distinct from any actual Reconstructed Volume, which may depend on the slice thickness chosen for a particular reconstruction" ]

     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113933" ];

  ], [
     fhir:index 1974;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113958" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Integrated Projection Radiography System" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A projection radiography system where the X-Ray detector, X-Ray Source and gantry components are integrated and the managing system is able to access details of each component" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1975;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113959" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Cassette-based Projection Radiography System" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A projection radiography system where the X-Ray detector, X-Ray Source and gantry components are not integrated; e.g. cassette-based CR and DR systems" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1976;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113961" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Reconstruction Algorithm" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Description of the algorithm used when reconstructing the image from the data acquired during the acquisition process" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1977;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113962" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Filtered Back Projection" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "An algorithm for reconstructing an image from multiple projections by back-projecting the measured values along the line of the projection and filtering the result to reduce blurring" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1978;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113963" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Iterative Reconstruction" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "An algorithm for reconstructing an image from multiple projections by starting with an assumed reconstructed image, computing projections from the image, comparing the original projection data and updating the reconstructed image based upon the difference between the calculated and the actual projections" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1979;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "113970" ];

  ], [
     fhir:index 1995;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "114204" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Pattern projection" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Projecting a narrow band of light onto a three-dimensionally shaped surface produces a line of illumination that appears distorted from other perspectives than that of the projector. It can be used for an exact geometric reconstruction of the surface shape" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1996;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "114205" ];

  ], [
     fhir:index 1997;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "114206" ];

  ], [
     fhir:index 1998;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "114207" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Confocal imaging" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "An optical imaging technique used to increase optical resolution and contrast of a micrograph by using point illumination and a spatial pinhole to eliminate out-of-focus light in specimens that are thicker than the focal plane. It enables the reconstruction of 3D structures from the obtained images" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 1999;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "114208" ];

  ], [
     fhir:index 2533;

     fhir:index 2534;

  ], [

  ], [
     fhir:index 2536;

  ], [
