     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "122337" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Relative position" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Longitudinal distance from the closest edge of a fiducial feature or reference location to the start of the vascular measurement. This value will be a positive if the measurement is distal to the fiducial feature or reference location, or negative if the measurement is proximal to the fiducial feature or reference location" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 2602;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "122339" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Stent Volume Obstruction" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "In-Stent Neointimal Volume / Stent Volume" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 2603;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "122340" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Fiducial feature" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Reference, normally anatomical, which is used for locating the position of a measurement" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 2604;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "122341" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Calcium Length" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Longitudinal calcium length measurement" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 2605;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "122343" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Lumen Eccentricity Index" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Measurement of vessel lumen eccentricity. Lumen Eccentricity Index = (maximum vessel lumen diameter - minimum vessel lumen diameter) / maximum vessel lumen diameter. Lumen diameters are measured through the center point of the lumen, which is defined as the center of gravity of the lumen area" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 2606;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "122344" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Plaque plus Media Eccentricity Index" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Plaque plus Media Eccentricity Index = (maximum Plaque plus media thickness - minimum Plaque plus media thickness) / maximum Plaque plus media thickness" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 2607;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "122345" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Remodeling Index" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Measurement of increase or decrease in EEM area that occurs during the development of atherosclerosis. Remodeling Index = Lesion EEM area / reference EEM area" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 2608;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "122346" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Stent Symmetry Index" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Measurement of stent circularity. Stent Symmetry Index = (maximum stent diameter - minimum stent diameter) / maximum stent diameter" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 2609;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "122347" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Stent Expansion Index" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Measurement of stent area relative to the reference lumen area. Stent Expansion Index = Minimum stent area / reference vessel lumen cross-sectional area" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 2610;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "122348" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Lumen Shape Index" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Measurement of vessel lumen eccentricity. Lumen Shape Index = (2p * sqrt(Vessel lumen cross-sectional area / p) / Lumen Perimeter) 2 Reference: Tobis & Yock, \"Intravascular Ultrasound Imaging\", Chapter 7" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 2611;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "122350" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Lumen Diameter Ratio" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Lumen diameter ratio = minimum vessel lumen diameter / maximum vessel lumen diameter, measured at the same cross section in the vessel. Lumen diameters are measured through the center point of the lumen, which is defined as the center of gravity of the lumen area" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 2612;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "122351" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Stent Diameter Ratio" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Stent diameter ratio = Minimum stent diameter / Maximum stent diameter, measured at the same cross section in the vessel. Stent diameters are measured through the center point of the stent, which is defined as the center of gravity of the stent area" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 2613;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "122352" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "EEM Diameter Ratio" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "EEM diameter ratio = minimum EEM diameter / maximum EEM diameter. Measured at the same cross section in the vessel" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 2614;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "122354" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Plaque Burden" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Fractional area within the External Elastic Membrane (EEM) occupied by atheroma. Plaque Burden = (EEM area - vessel lumen cross-sectional area) / EEM area" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 2615;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "122355" ];

  ], [

     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "122465" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "RCA Region in ROA Projection" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Based on a total number of chords of 100 and RAO project the range of chords belonging to this circumferential extent lies between 25 - 85. [Sheehan, 1986]" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 2685;

  ], [
     fhir:index 2945;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "125202" ];

  ], [
     fhir:index 2946;

  ], [
     fhir:index 2947;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "125204" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Area-length biplane" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Method for calculating left ventricular volume from two orthogonal views containing the true long axis (usually the apical 4 and 2 chamber views). Volume = [pL1 / 6] * [(4A1) Ã· (pL1) ] * [(4A2) Ã· (pL2) ]" ]
  ], [

  ], [

  ], [
     fhir:index 2950;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "125207" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Method of Disks, Biplane" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Method of calculating volume based on the summation of disk volumes. The disk axis is parallel to the left ventricular long axis and using a disk diameter averaged from the two chamber and four chamber views" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 2951;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "125208" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Method of Disks, Single Plane" ];

  ], [
     fhir:index 2952;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "125209" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Teichholz" ];

  ], [
     fhir:index 2953;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "125210" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Area by Pressure Half-Time" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Mitral valve area (cm2) by Pressure Half-time = 220 (cm2.ms) / PHT (ms)" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 2954;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "125211" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Biplane Ellipse" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Area = P/4 X d1 X d2 d1 = anterior/posterior axis d2 = medial/lateral axis Hagen-Ansert, Sandra L., Textbook of Diagnostic Ultrasound, ed. 3, The C.V.Mosby Co., 1989, p. 73. " ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 2955;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "125212" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Continuity Equation" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "For conduits in series (\"in continuity\"), volume flow is equal: A1*V1 = A2*V2. where V is the velocity" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 2956;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "125213" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Continuity Equation by Mean Velocity" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "For conduits in series (\"in continuity\"), volume flow is equal: A1*V1 = A2*V2. where V is the mean velocity" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 2957;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "125214" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Continuity Equation by Peak Velocity" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "For conduits in series (\"in continuity\"), volume flow is equal: A1*V1 = A2*V2. where V is the peak velocity" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 2958;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "125215" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Continuity Equation by Velocity Time Integral" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "For conduits in series (\"in continuity\"), volume flow is equal: A1*V1 = A2*V2. where V is the velocity time integral" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 2959;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "125216" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Proximal Isovelocity Surface Area" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Utilizes aliasing velocity (by color Doppler) of flow into an orifice (often regurgitant or stenotic) to measure instantaneous flow rate, orifice area, and flow volume. The instantaneous flow rate = (2Ï€r2vav ) * (Î± / Ï€) where vav is the constant velocity known as aliasing velocity at radius r, vp is the peak velocity at the orifice, and Î± is the angle in radians of the constant velocity surface. Estimated Orifice area = Flow rate / vp , where vp is the peak velocity at the orifice and the flow rate is the PISA peak flow rate. The volume flow is then the product of the orifice area and Velocity Time Integral" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 2960;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "125217" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Full Bernoulli" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Î”P = 4*(V12 - V22)" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 2961;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "125218" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Simplified Bernoulli" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Î”P = 4*V2" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 2962;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "125219" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Doppler Volume Flow" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Volume flow = Conduit CSA * (Velocity Time Integral)" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 2963;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "125220" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Planimetry" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Direct measurement of an area by tracing an irregular perimeter" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 2964;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "125221" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Left Ventricle Mass by M-mode" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Mass = 1.04 * [(ST+LVID+PWT)3 - LVID3] * 0.8+ 0.6. Mass unit is grams and length in cm" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 2965;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "125222" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Left Ventricle Mass by Truncated Ellipse" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Mass = 1.05P ((b + t)2 X (2/3 (a + t) + d - d3 /3(a + t)2) - b2 (2/3a + d - d3 /3a2)) a = Semi-major axis from widest minor axis radius to apex. b = Short axis radius calculated from short axis cavity area t = Myocardial thickness calculated from short axis epicardial and cavity areas d = Truncated semi-major axis from widest short axis diameter to plane of mitral annulus. Mass unit is grams and length in cm. Schiller NB et al: Recommendations for quantification of the left ventricle by two-dimensional echocardiography, American Society of Echocardiography 2:364, 1989. " ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 2966;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "125223" ];

  ], [
     fhir:index 2998;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "125270" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Left Ventricle Mass by Area Length" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "method to measure the mass of the Left Ventricle via the ASE area-length method at end diastole. LV Mass = 1.05*(5/6*(A1*(L+t)) - 5/6*(A2*L)) A1 = Left Ventricle epicardial SAX area at the level of the papillary muscle tips at end diastole. A2 = Left Ventricle endocardial SAX area cavity area at the level of the papillary muscle tips at end diastole. L = Left Ventricle apical view long axis length at end diastole. t = Myocardial thickness can be computed as: t = sqrt (A1/3.14) - sqrt (A2/3.14) Reference: 1) Schiller, N.B., et al. \"Recommendations for Quantification of the LV by Two-dimensional Echocardiography.\" J Am Soc Echo, Vol. 2, No. 5: 358-367, Sep-Oct 1989. 2) Reichek, N., et al. \"Anatomic Validation of Left Ventricular Mass Estimates from Clinical Two-dimensional Echocardiography: Initial Results.\" Circulation, Vol. 67, No. 2: 348-52, February 1983" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 2999;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "125271" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Left Ventricle Mass by M-mode - adjusted by Height" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Equation = Left Ventricle Mass by M-mode (in gram) / (Height (in meter)) ^2.7 Reference: Giovanni De Simone, et al. \"Effect of Growth on Variability of Left Ventricular Mass: Assessment of Allometric Signals in Adults and Children and Their Capacity to Predict Cardiovascular Risk\". New York, New York and Cincinnati, Ohio" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3000;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "125272" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Left Ventricle Mass by Truncated Ellipse - adjusted by Height" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Equation = Left Ventricle Mass by Truncated Ellipse / Height^2.7 Reference: Giovanni De Simone, et al. \"Effect of Growth on Variability of Left Ventricular Mass: Assessment of Allometric Signals in Adults and Children and Their Capacity to Predict Cardiovascular Risk\". New York, New York and Cincinnati, Ohio" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3001;

     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126011" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Derived Imaging Measurements" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Measurements derived from measurements made on images" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3016;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126020" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Multiparametric MRI" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "An MRI procedure in which multiple parameters including diffusion, dynamic contrast and T2 are measured" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3017;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126021" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Multiparametric MRI of prostate" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "An MRI procedure of the prostate in which multiple parameters including diffusion, dynamic contrast and T2 are measured" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3018;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126022" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Multiparametric MRI of whole body" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "An MRI procedure of the whole body in which multiple parameters including diffusion, dynamic contrast and T2 are measured" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3019;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126030" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Sum of segmented voxel volumes" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The volume derived by summing the volumes of all the voxels (and partial voxels if the segment contains partially occupied voxels) included in the segment" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3020;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126031" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Peak Value Within ROI" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Maximum average gray value that is calculated from a 1 cubic centimeter sphere placed within the region of interest. Reference Wahl et al PERCIST article" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3021;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126032" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Metabolic Volume" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The volume of a lesion (e.g. a tumor) ascertained through information about its metabolic activity (e.g. SUV on PET). Abbreviated \"MV\". Synonymous with Metabolic Tumor Volume (MTV)" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3022;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126033" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Total Lesion Glycolysis" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The total activity of a lesion obtained as the product of its volume and its glycolytic activity (on FDG-PET). The volume may be defined on the same modality (e.g. the MV on FDG-PET by some thresholding or other technique) or on another spatially registered modality (e.g. the lesion outline segmented on CT or MR). Does not apply to other radiopharmaceuticals than those involved in glucose metabolism. Abbreviated TLG. Synonymnous with \"Tumor Lesion Glycolysis\"" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3023;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126034" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Glycolysis" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The amount glycolytic activity summed across all voxels in a defined region or within a defined range of SUV (on FDG-PET)" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3024;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126035" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Total Lesion Proliferation" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The total activity of a lesion obtained as the product of its volume and its proliferative activity (on FLT-PET). The volume may be defined on the same modality (e.g. the MV on FDG-PET by some thresholding or other technique) or on another spatially registered modality (e.g. the lesion outline segmented on CT or MR). Does not apply to other radiopharmaceuticals than those involved in cellular proliferation. Abbreviated TLP. Synonymnous with \"Tumor Lesion Proliferation\"" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3025;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126036" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Proliferative Activity" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The amount proliferative activity summed across all voxels in a defined region or within a defined range of SUV (on FLT-PET)" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3026;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126037" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Standardized Added Metabolic Activity (SAM)" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A background-corrected, partial volume independent version of TLG. SAM is calculated by drawing a volume of interest (VOI1) around the tumour and a larger VOI (VOI2) around VOI1. Subtracting the background activity in VOI2-VOI1 from VOI1 yields SAM. See Mertens et al. \"Standardized added metabolic activity (SAM): a partial volume independent marker of total lesion glycolysis in liver metastases\". Eur J Nucl Med Mol Imaging (2012) 39:1441-1448" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3027;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126038" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Standardized Added Metabolic Activity (SAM) Background" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The background value (VOI2-VOI1) used to calculate Standardized Added Metabolic Activity (SAM). SAM is calculated by drawing a volume of interest (VOI1) around the tumour and a larger VOI (VOI2) around VOI1. Subtracting the background activity in VOI2-VOI1 from VOI1 yields SAM. See Mertens et al. \"Standardized added metabolic activity (SAM): a partial volume independent marker of total lesion glycolysis in liver metastases\". Eur J Nucl Med Mol Imaging (2012) 39:1441-1448" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3028;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126039" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Lesion to Background SUV Ratio" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The ratio of the SUV within a tumor to the SUV of a pre-defined background region. Need reference(s). A more general concept than Tumor to Background Ratio (TBR)" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3029;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126040" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Background for Lesion to Background SUV Ratio" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The SUV of a pre-defined background region used to compute Lesion to Background SUV Ratio. Need reference(s)" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3030;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126050" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Fractal Dimension" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A statistical index of complexity comparing how detail in a fractal pattern changes with the scale at which it is measured; a ratio of the change in detail to the change in scale" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3031;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126051" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Skewness" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Measure of the asymmetry of the probability distribution of a real-valued random variable about its mean" ]

     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126052" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Kurtosis" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Measure of the peakedness of the probability distribution of a real-valued random variable" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3033;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126060" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Entropy of GLCM" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The zero order entropy of a Gray Level Co-occurrence Matrix (GLCM). A measure of disorder. See http://www.fp.ucalgary.ca/mhallbey/equations.htm" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3034;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126061" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Energy of GLCM" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The energy (uniformity) (square root of the Angular Second Moment (ASM)) of a Gray Level Co-occurrence Matrix (GLCM). A measure of orderliness. See http://www.fp.ucalgary.ca/mhallbey/equations.htm" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3035;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126062" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Homogeneity of GLCM" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The Inverse Difference Moment of a Gray Level Co-occurrence Matrix (GLCM). See http://www.fp.ucalgary.ca/mhallbey/equations.htm" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3036;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126063" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Contrast of GLCM" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The sum of squares variance of a Gray Level Co-occurrence Matrix (GLCM). See http://www.fp.ucalgary.ca/mhallbey/equations.htm" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3037;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126064" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Dissimilarity of GLCM" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The dissimilarity of a Gray Level Co-occurrence Matrix (GLCM). See http://www.fp.ucalgary.ca/mhallbey/equations.htm" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3038;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126065" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "ASM of GLCM" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The Angular Second Moment of a Gray Level Co-occurrence Matrix (GLCM). See http://www.fp.ucalgary.ca/mhallbey/equations.htm" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3039;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126066" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Correlation of GLCM" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A measure of the linear dependency of grey levels on those of neighbouring pixels of a Gray Level Co-occurrence Matrix (GLCM). See http://www.fp.ucalgary.ca/mhallbey/equations.htm" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3040;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126067" ];

  ], [
     fhir:index 3069;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126340" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Standard Tofts Model" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A tracer diffusion kinetic model in which the permeability is assumed to be isodirectional. See P. Tofts, \"Modeling tracer kinetics in dynamic Gd-DTPA MR imaging\", Journal of Magnetic Resonance Imaging, vol. 7, pp. 91-101, 1997" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3070;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126341" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Extended Tofts Model" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A tracer diffusion kinetic model in which the permeability is not assumed to be isodirectional, and which includes the contribution of tracer in the blood plasma to the total tissue concentration. See P. Tofts, \"Modeling tracer kinetics in dynamic Gd-DTPA MR imaging\", Journal of Magnetic Resonance Imaging, vol. 7, pp. 91-101, 1997" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3071;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126342" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Model-free concentration-time quantitification" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A semiquantitative analysis of the contrast-enhancement concentration versus time curve that avoids the use of a pharmacokinetic model; e.g. integration to compute the initial area under the curve" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3072;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126343" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "First Pass Leakage Profile (FPLP)" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A tracer diffusion kinetic model that accounts for the tumor leakage profile during the first pass of contrast. See Li, Ka-Loh, Xiao Ping Zhu, John Waterton, and Alan Jackson. \"Improved 3D Quantitative Mapping of Blood Volume and Endothelial Permeability in Brain Tumors.\" Journal of Magnetic Resonance Imaging 12, no. 2 (2000): 347-357. doi:10.1002/1522-2586(200008)12:2<347::AID-JMRI19>3.0.CO;2-7" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3073;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126344" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Shutter-Speed Model (SSM)" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A tracer diffusion kinetic model that does not assume that intercompartmental water molecule exchange is infinitely fast. See Li, Xin, Wei Huang, Thomas E. Yankeelov, Alina Tudorica, William D. Rooney, and Charles S. Springer. \"Shutter-Speed Analysis of Contrast Reagent Bolus-Tracking Data: Preliminary Observations in Benign and Malignant Breast Disease.\" Magnetic Resonance in Medicine 53, no. 3 (2005): 724-29. doi:10.1002/mrm.20405" ]
  ], [

  ], [
     fhir:index 3082;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126364" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Blind Estimation of AIF" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A data-driven blind source separation (BSS) algorithm that estimates AIF from individuals without any presumed AIF model and initialization. See Lin, Yu-Chun, Tsung-Han Chan, Chong-Yung Chi, Shu-Hang Ng, Hao-Li Liu, Kuo-Chen Wei, Yau-Yau Wai, Chun-Chieh Wang, and Jiun-Jie Wang. \"Blind Estimation of the Arterial Input Function in Dynamic Contrast-Enhanced MRI Using Purity Maximization.\" Magnetic Resonance in Medicine 68, no. 5 (November 1, 2012): 1439-49. doi:10.1002/mrm.24144" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3083;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126370" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Time of Peak Concentration" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The time at which the concentration-time curve achieves its peak for the first time. Used as a concept name for a value or as a method; e.g. used as a method of calculation for BAT. See Shpilfoygel Med Phys 2008. doi: 10.1118/1.1288669" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3084;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126371" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Bolus Arrival Time" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The nominal time at which arrival of a contrast bolus is detected, which is used as a reference point for subsequent calculations. Used as a concept name for a value or as a method. No specific computational method is implied by this general definition. Abbreviated BAT" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3085;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126372" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Time of Leading Half-Peak Concentration" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The time at which the concentration-time curve achieves half of its peak density for the first time. Used as a concept name for a value or as a method; e.g. used as a method of calculation for BAT. See Shpilfoygel Med Phys 2008. doi: 10.1118/1.1288669" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3086;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126373" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Temporal Derivative Exceeds Threshold" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A method of determining BAT that involves computing the temporal derivative of the concentration-time curve and selecting the time when the temporal derivative exceeds a specified threshold. See Shpilfoygel Med Phys 2008. doi: 10.1118/1.1288669" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3087;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126374" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Temporal Derivative Threshold" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A threshold applied to the temporal derivative of the concentration-time curve; e.g. used to establish BAT. See Shpilfoygel Med Phys 2008. doi: 10.1118/1.1288669" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3088;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126375" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Maximum Slope" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The maximum rate of signal intensity change within a measured region of a time-activity curve. See Boonsirikamchai, Piyaporn, Harmeet Kaur, Deborah A. Kuban, Edward Jackson, Ping Hou, and Haesun Choi. \"Use of Maximum Slope Images Generated From Dynamic Contrast-Enhanced MRI to Detect Locally Recurrent Prostate Carcinoma After Prostatectomy: A Practical Approach.\" American Journal of Roentgenology 198, no. 3 (March 1, 2012): W228-W236. doi:10.2214/AJR.10.6387" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3089;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126376" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Maximum Difference" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The maximum degree of signal intensity change within a measured region of a time-activity curve. See Boonsirikamchai, Piyaporn, Harmeet Kaur, Deborah A. Kuban, Edward Jackson, Ping Hou, and Haesun Choi. \"Use of Maximum Slope Images Generated From Dynamic Contrast-Enhanced MRI to Detect Locally Recurrent Prostate Carcinoma After Prostatectomy: A Practical Approach.\" American Journal of Roentgenology 198, no. 3 (March 1, 2012): W228-W236. doi:10.2214/AJR.10.6387" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3090;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126377" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Tracer Concentration" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Tracer concentration in tissue; e.g. in a DCE-MR experiment, the concentration of contrast agent in mmol/l" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3091;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126380" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Contrast Longitudinal Relaxivity" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The degree to which a paramagnetic contrast agent can enhance the proton longitudinal relaxation rate constant (R1, 1/T1), normalized to the concentration of the contrast agent. Also referred to as r1. Typically expressed in units of l/mmol/s" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3092;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126390" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Regional Blood Flow" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The flow rate of blood perfusing a region as volume per mass per unit of time" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3093;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126391" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Regional Blood Volume" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The volume of blood perfusing a region as volume per mass" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3094;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126392" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Oxygen Extraction Fraction" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The percent of the oxygen removed from the blood by tissue during its passage through the capillary network. For example, as measured by blood oxygenation level dependent (BOLD) MR. See He, Xiang, and Dmitriy A. Yablonskiy. \"Quantitative BOLD: Mapping of Human Cerebral Deoxygenated Blood Volume and Oxygen Extraction Fraction: Default State.\" Magnetic Resonance in Medicine 57, no. 1 (2007): 115-26" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3095;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126393" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "R1" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The longitiudinal relaxation rate constant. The inverse of longitudinal relaxation time, i.e., R1 = 1/T1" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3096;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126394" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "R2" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "The transverse relaxation rate constant. The inverse of transverse relaxation time, i.e., R2 = 1/T2" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3097;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126400" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "Standardized Uptake Value" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "A ratio of locally measured radioactivity concentration versus the injected radioactivity distributed evenly throughout the whole body. This general concept encompasses all specific methods of calculating the whole body volume of distribution, such as using body weight, lean body mass, body surface area, etc." ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3098;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126401" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "SUVbw" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Standardized Uptake Value calculated using body weight. The patient size correction factor for males and females is body weight. Defined in Sugawara et al. Reevaluation of the Standardized Uptake Value for FDG: Variations with Body Weight and Methods for Correction.Radiology, 1999 at http://radiology.rsna.org/content/213/2/521" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3099;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126402" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "SUVlbm" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Standardized Uptake Value calculated using lean body mass. The patient size correction factor for males is 1.10 * weight - 120 * (weight/height) ^2, and for females is 1.07 * weight - 148 * (weight/height) ^2. Defined in Sugawara et al. Reevaluation of the Standardized Uptake Value for FDG: Variations with Body Weight and Methods for Correction.Radiology, 1999 at http://radiology.rsna.org/content/213/2/521" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3100;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126403" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "SUVbsa" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Standardized Uptake Value calculated using body surface area. The patient size correction factor for males and females is weight^ 0.425 * height^0.725 * 0.007184. Defined in Sugawara et al. Reevaluation of the Standardized Uptake Value for FDG: Variations with Body Weight and Methods for Correction.Radiology, 1999 at http://radiology.rsna.org/content/213/2/521" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3101;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126404" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "SUVibw" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Standardized Uptake Value calculated using ideal body weight. Reevaluation of the Standardized Uptake Value for FDG: Variations with Body Weight and Methods for Correction.Radiology, 1999 at http://radiology.rsna.org/content/213/2/521" ]

     fhir:index 3154;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126810" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "IEC6127 Gantry Continuous Pitch Angle" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Gantry Pitch Continuous Angle in degrees of the radiation source, i.e., the rotation about the X-axis of the IEC GANTRY coordinate system [IEC 61217]" ]
  ], [
     fhir:index 3155;
     fhir:CodeSystem.code [ fhir:value "126811" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.display [ fhir:value "IEC6127 Gantry Continuous Yaw Angle" ];
     fhir:CodeSystem.definition [ fhir:value "Gantry Yaw Continuous Angle in degrees of the radiation source, i.e., about the Z-axis of the IEC GANTRY coordinate system [IEC 61217]" ]
  ] .
